item.description:
We will be meeting in E51

Feature Talk: March 28, 2007

How to spot trend reversals using technical analysis, presented by Harlan Rieur

Harlan will explain how he finds reversals, that elusive prize, using technical analysis. He will explain how he uses MACD crossovers with Williams % indexes. He will also explain how he uses the Rydex/Ursa fund ratio, put/call ratios, and the VIX. Bring your questions and we'll have some fun!

Harlan Rieur has been investing since his father got him started at age 13. Initially he used Graham and Dodd type fundamental analysis. During the 1980's he moved to Technical analysis. Professionally he has been a Chiropractor in Brookline for 22 years. He is a Doctor of Chiropractic, has a degree in business administration and a minor in economics from Boston University .

Harlan funded his education through investing and continues to be fascinated by this life long passion. Harlan spends half his time in each endeavor (Chiropractic and investing). He has been coming to our meetings for several months.

The agenda for the meetup will be:
7:00 Fred Sears's Q&A, then a Market Discussion led by Doug
8:00 Harlan Rieur's feature presentation (described above)
9:00 Break followed by Stock picks discussion led by Mike Kinkead

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required.
item.name: The Boston Investor's Business Daily March Meetup
